heading: impressive earnings from apple
subheading: the revived computer maker reports solidly better-than-expected earnings. the number of macs shipped in the quarter jumps 27 percent.
author: reuters
text: apple computer extended its recovery with stronger-than-expected second-quarter earnings on wednesday, boosted by the colorful imac computers and new power macintoshes aimed at high-end users. apple's second-quarter net income more than doubled to us$135 million, or 84 cents a share, including one-time gains, compared with a net income of $55 million, or 38 cents a share, a year ago.excluding special gains, apple posted a profit of $93 million, or 60 cents a share, in the latest quarter. that compared with analysts' expectations of 57 cents, according to first call.revenues climbed to $1.53 billion, up 9 percent from the year-ago quarter, although, as expected, below the level of the strong fourth quarter, when christmas season sales helped it reach $1.71 billion.in a sign of strong demand for its products, apple (aapl) ended the quarter with only one day of inventory on hand, lower than even such industry standard bearers as made-to-order dell computer."apple grew faster than the industry in its sixth consecutive profitable quarter," said steve jobs, apple's interim ceo.jobs cited the use of strong "asset management" in lowering inventories. operating efficiencies also led to improved profitability, as gross margin climbed to 26.3 percent from 24.8 percent the prior year.in unit shipment terms, the company's sales improved even more strongly. the company sold 27 percent more computers. apple reported that half its sales came from abroad.ahead of the earnings report, which came after the stock market closed, apple stock added 91 cents to end the day at $35.53 on nasdaq.copyright
